page.title: 05Recreation in Colmonell
page.content: Colmonell's main recreation area is the local park which adjoins the bowling green. In the park there are swings,a chute and a roundabout in addition to a small football field. The local bowling club is quite popular with locals and visitors alike but the village's best known recreational asset is the local river, the Stinchar. The river Stinchar is known throughout Scotland as a fine salmon and sea-trout river and the local angling club holds one bank of the river near the village.The best runs of salmon and sea-trout occur in late Autumn when many visiting anglers appear overnight if conditions are good.The river is at it's best during and after a spate.
